info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 7:03PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Spartanburg and west central Cherokee Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 702 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Spartanburg, or near Boiling Springs SC, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Boiling Springs SC, North Spartanburg, Cowpens, Inman, Mayo, Pacolet Mills, USC Upstate, Cedar Springs, Croft State Park and Pacolet. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
